Good question

How to interact with online community and receive answers to your questions

You are most likely arrived here for community discussion. If you are new to online discussion, please spend half a minute reading instructions below how to make sure you get better input from the community.

Every question needs background

Tell who are, what is background to your situation and what have you tried this far? People can relate your problems when they have more context information available.

More info

Often, if you are inexperienced in the area

Be patient

Wait answer patiently, don't repeat your question. People might be monitoring community chat only once in an hour. Please pe prepared to spend at least this time to see if anyone can answer to your question. If you don't get answers try alternative, non real-time, forum.

More info

Often, if you are inexperienced in the area

Don't compete for attentation

Don't ask permission to ask questions. Don't ask personal councelling or send private messages to people unless they know you. Just greet, ask your question, wait for answer and enjoy smalltalk meanwhile.

More info

Even if the problem in your hand is most urgent for you, it's probably not critical for other people. Extra helps, pleases and pledges won't change the factual content of your question or make it easier to answer.

People participate online communities voluntary. It's not a help desk and they are not on payroll. They do it, because they love what they do. But they are only human; they have limited knowledge and might be on bad mood for unrelated reasons. Even if you don't get answers don't let it ruin your day and try again later.
